Entities.Name: Protein
Entities.Definition: Names of proteins that participate in biological functions, commonly appearing in biomedical literature. Includes single proteins and protein complexes.

Entities.Name: DNA
Entities.Definition: Names of DNA sequences, including genes or parts of the genome that are relevant in biomedical processes.

Entities.Name: RNA
Entities.Definition: Mentions of RNA sequences, including mRNA, miRNA, and other forms of transcribed genetic material.

Entities.Name: Cell line
Entities.Definition: References to specific cell lines used in research or clinical contexts, often used in experimental studies.

Entities.Name: Cell type
Entities.Definition: Biological cell types categorized based on structure or function, such as immune cells, epithelial cells, etc.

Entities.Name: Disease
Entities.Definition: Medical conditions identified in biomedical text, including genetic disorders, infections, and syndromes.

Dataset.Name: JNLPBA and NCBI-Disease
Dataset.Description: Two benchmark datasets for biomedical NER. JNLPBA contains 22,402 sentences with five biomedical entity types. NCBI-Disease consists of 793 abstracts annotated for disease mentions.

AnnotationGuidelines.Description: Annotations in JNLPBA follow the GENIA guidelines, where each entity must be a full phrase with a BIO-tagging scheme. NCBI-Disease entities are annotated for disease names normalized to MEDIC terms. Evaluation is based on exact span-level matches.
